summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, transmitting a production of discovery materials. The materials include a contact book, estate documents, UK records, and handwritten notes, all designated as confidential under a protective order.

events.title: Discovery Production to Maxwell Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces a batch of discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, including contact books, estate documents, and handwritten notes.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced discovery materials including a contact book, materials from Jeffrey Epstein's estate, records from the United Kingdom, and handwritten notes on a legal pad.
All produced materials were designated as confidential under a July 31, 2020 protective order, with specific markings to avoid confusion with classified document designations.
The document references 'Government Exhibit 52,' indicating these materials are part of the evidentiary record in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
The letter is signed by Damian Williams, the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.
The production index shows Bates numbers SDNY_GM_02765768 through SDNY_GM_02767073, indicating a substantial volume of documents.
